newsitem.title: FRANCE: French SNCF railways see bigger 1996 loss - source.
newsitem.headline: French SNCF railways see bigger 1996 loss - source.

text.p: France's SNCF state railway company made a first-half loss of around 7.2 billion francs ($1.4 billion) after weaker passenger and freight traffic than forecast, and now expects a bigger year loss, a source close to the SNCF said on Wednesday.

The loss in the first half of 1995 was 5.99 billion francs and the SNCF is now counting on a loss of 12.5 billion francs for the year as a whole, compared to earlier expectations of a loss of 12.1 billion, the source said.
The company would give no official comment on the results.
The source also said SNCF sales had fallen 0.7 percent to 27.48 billion due to falling goods traffic and the carry-over effect from the late 1995 rail strikes.
The SNCF's 1995 loss was 16.6 billion francs.
The source said the company would redouble its marketing and cost control efforts in the light of the figures for the first half of 1996.
